abstract.description: An abstract class is a high level class or slot that is typically used to group common slots together and is generally not instantiated. When generating golr-views, abstract classes are ignored

alias.description: A name to be assigned to the slot in implementations that is different that its type.  The primary use for this is to allow class AND schema definitions to both have "slots" where one inline and the other a reference

apply_to.description: Used to extend an existing class definition. For example, if we have a core schema where a gene has two slots for identifier and symbol, and we have a specialized schema for my_organism where we wish to add a slot systematic_name, we can avoid subclassing by defining a class gene_my_organism, adding the slot to this class, and then adding an apply_to pointing to the gene class. The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

broader_matches.description: a list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have a broader, more general meaning. Broader terms are typically shown as parents in a hierarchy or tree.

class_definition_is_a.description: specifies single-inheritance between classes and slots. While multiple inheritance is not allowed, mixins can be provided effectively providing the same thing. The semantics are the same when translated to formalisms that allow MI (e.g. RDFS/OWL). When translating to a SI framework (e.g. java classes, python classes) then is_a is used. When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is_a and mixins are recursively unfolded

class_definition_mixins.description: List of definitions to be mixed in. Targets may be any definition of the same type

class_definition_union_of.description: list of class or slot definitions that are combined to create the union class

close_matches.description: a list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have a semantically similar but not strictly equivalent, broader, or narrower meaning. Such terms often describe the same general concept from different ontological perspectives (e.g. drug as a type of chemical entity versus drug as a type of role borne by a chemical entity).

default_curi_maps.description: List of prefixcommon biocontexts to be fetched to resolve id_prefixes and inline prefix variables

default_prefix.description: default and base prefix -- used for ':' identifiers, @base and @vocab

default_type.description: the default type if range is omitted

defining_slots.description: The combination of is_a plus defining slots form a genus-differentia definition, or the set of necessary and sufficient conditions that can be transformed into an OWL equivalence axiom

domain.description: The class to which this slot applies.

exact_matches.description: a list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have strictly equivalent meanings.

examples.description: Example of usage for a slot or class

from_schema.description: id of the schema that the element was derived from.  Supplied by the loader.

generation_date.description: date that the schema was loaded/generated.  Supplied by the loader

id.description: a globally unique id or url for a schema

identifier.description: True means that this slot must be unique across the collection of slots

imports.description: A list of modules that are imported into the schema

in_subset.description: used to indicate membership of a term in a defined subset of biolink terms used for a particular domain or application (e.g. the translator_minimal subset holding the minimal set of predicates used in a translator knowledge graph)

inherited.description: True means that the slot is an essential attribute of the container -- that the slot is carried across is_a and slot_usage paths

inlined.description: if true then the value of this slot is inlined (i.e. a nested object) rather linked by key

inverse.description: used to indicate the inverse of a slot (e.g. 'expresses' is the inverse predicate of 'expressed in')

is_a.description: specifies single-inheritance between classes and slots. While multiple inheritance is not allowed, mixins can be provided effectively providing the same thing. The semantics are the same when translated to formalisms that allow MI (e.g. RDFS/OWL). When translating to a SI framework (e.g. java classes, python classes) then is_a is used. When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is_a and mixins are recursively unfolded

local_name.description: the nsname (sans ':' for a given prefix)

local_names.description: map from local identifier to slot

mappings.description: a list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have comparable meaning. These may include terms that are precisely equivalent, broader or narrower in meaning, or otherwise semantically related but not equivalent from a strict ontological perspective.

metamodel_version.description: Version of the metamodel used to load the schema. Supplied by the loader

mixin.description: Used only as a mixin -- cannot be instantiated on its own.

mixins.description: List of definitions to be mixed in. Targets may be any definition of the same type

multivalued.description: If true slot can have many values

name.description: a unique key that identifies a slot, type or class in a schema

narrower_matches.description: a list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have a narrower, more specific meaning. Narrower terms are typically shown as children in a hierarchy or tree.

object_property.description: true means that this slot is part of the formal definition of a class

path.description: For any denormalized slot, this represents the tree or graph path used to generate the denormalized form

prefix_uri.description: A URI associated with a given prefix

prefixes.description: Additional prefixes to be added to the context beyond those fetched from prefixcommons in id_prefixes

primary_key.description: True means that this serves as a unique identifier

range.description: The slot type.  Can be any class or type

required.description: If true slot must have at least one value

singular_name.description: a name that is used in the singular form

slot_definition_is_a.description: specifies single-inheritance between classes and slots. While multiple inheritance is not allowed, mixins can be provided effectively providing the same thing. The semantics are the same when translated to formalisms that allow MI (e.g. RDFS/OWL). When translating to a SI framework (e.g. java classes, python classes) then is_a is used. When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is_a and mixins are recursively unfolded

slot_definition_mixins.description: List of definitions to be mixed in. Targets may be any definition of the same type

slot_definition_union_of.description: list of class or slot definitions that are combined to create the union class

slot_definitions.description: collection of slot definitions in a schema

slot_usage.description: Additional info on how a slot is used in the context of a class. Many slots may be re-used across different classes, but the meaning of the slot may be refined by context. For example, a generic association model may use slots subject/predicate/object with generic semantics and minimal constraints. When this is subclasses, e.g. to disease-phenotype associations then slot_usage may specify both local naming (e.g. subject=disease) and local constraints

slots.description: list of slot names that are applicable to a class. slots are by default inherited over is_a and mixins.

source.description: the source of description or other element

source_file.description: name, uri or description of the source of the schema.  Supplied by the loader

source_file_date.description: modification date of the source of the schema.  Supplied by the loader

source_file_size.description: size in bytes of the source of the schema.  Supplied by the loader

subclass_of.description: Ontolgy property which this is a subclass of. Not to be confused with is_a which links datamodel classes

subproperty_of.description: Ontolgy property which this is a subproperty of

typeof.description: a builtin ('string', 'integer', 'float', 'double', 'boolean', 'time', 'uri') or another type definition

union_of.description: list of class or slot definitions that are combined to create the union class

values_from.description: identifies the possible uri's of the range

source.description: the source of description or other element

apply_to.description: Used to extend an existing class definition. For example, if we have a core schema where a gene has two slots for identifier and symbol, and we have a specialized schema for my_organism where we wish to add a slot systematic_name, we can avoid subclassing by defining a class gene_my_organism, adding the slot to this class, and then adding an apply_to pointing to the gene class. The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is_a and mixins are recursively unfolded
